definition: end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular

sentences.english: I gave the strange man the double-O.
sentences.chinese: 我仔細端詳了這位陌生人。

sentences.english: As she placed one in her left eye she halted and stared into the mirror intently.
sentences.chinese: 她左眼戴上隱形眼鏡，對着鏡子仔細地端詳。

sentences.english: By the dim light, you study his kind and fatherly face.
sentences.chinese: 透過暗光，你端詳他友好如父的臉龐。

sentences.english: Watching her, I pondered doing something uplifting with the rest of the day.
sentences.chinese: 我端詳着她，開始琢磨在今天剩下的時間裏做些什麼。

sentences.english: Just look at the cover of your book.
sentences.chinese: 只要端詳一下你書上的封面。

sentences.english: He gave her a critical and condescending look-over.
sentences.chinese: 他用遷就的眼光細細地端詳了她一下。

sentences.english: He pushes me out of the water and examines my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他把我從噴頭下推開，然後端詳着我的眼睛。

sentences.english: She gazes down at the man lying naked in her bed.
sentences.chinese: 她向下端詳着在她的牀上躺着的赤裸的男人。

sentences.english: Portia looked at Bassanio's face and was sure that something terrible had happened.
sentences.chinese: 波西亞端詳着巴塞尼奧的臉，確信有重大事情發生。

sentences.english: He found himself looking at the young bucks at the bath.
sentences.chinese: 他發現他常常在端詳浴場上的那些花花公子。

sentences.english: Ivetta fell silent, arched her neck, and studied him.
sentences.chinese: 艾薇塔陷入了沉默，向後仰起脖子，端詳着他。

sentences.english: Look at the palms of your hands.
Marilla watched the happy young face.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗拉端詳着安妮年輕快樂的臉。

sentences.english: She leaned forward to scrutinize their faces.
sentences.chinese: 她探身向前，端詳他們的面容。

sentences.english: The tiny gnome peered over the railing into the secluded Dalaran courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 嬌小的侏儒透過欄杆端詳着魔法罩下的達拉然。

sentences.english: The owner of the antique mansion and designer Zhang Lianzhi are observing a antique vase.
sentences.chinese: 古瓷樓的主人兼設計者張連志在端詳一個古瓷瓶。

definition: to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
no matter what/despite/to allow (sb to act arbitrarily)
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
to chat with a low voice
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
to push aside/to part/to brush away
